page.title: 03VILLAGE STUDY,MISKIN
page.content: {LANDSCAPE/BUILDINGS:}Situated some 20 metres above the river, it is on the crossroads between the Pendoylan to Pontypridd and Cardiff to Talbot Green roads. Founded in Norman times as part of the Miskin Manor Estate. In 1871 it had the Miskin Arms public house, a blacksmith, a cornmill, a bootmaker, a joiner, a butcher and a grocer. {SHAPE:}Nucleated, with modern housing estates in Manor grounds and north of the designated Conservation Area, with some protected buildings over 150 yrs. old. {FUNCTIONS:}No industrial development planned, with only limited expansion for commuter-type property. Most families own a car. The only shop recently closed. There is a half- hourly bus service to Cardiff.
